    • bindTo

      @NotNull public @NotNull XMLMapper bindTo(@NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends Bindable> targetType)
      Description copied from interface: ReadingMapper
      Binds the mapper to the specified class type.

      Binding a class type allows the mapper to recognize and serialize instances of that type. This method may perform initialization or validation necessary for handling the specified type.

      Specified by:
      bindTo in interface ReadingMapper<XMLMapper,Bindable>
      Parameters:
      targetType - the Class object representing the type to bind to
      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining

    • unbind

      @NotNull public @NotNull XMLMapper unbind(@NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends Bindable> targetType)
      Description copied from interface: ReadingMapper
      Unbinds the mapper from the specified class type.

      Unbinding a class type removes the mapper's ability to recognize and serialize instances of that type. This can be useful for dynamically managing supported types at runtime.

      Specified by:
      unbind in interface ReadingMapper<XMLMapper,Bindable>
      Parameters:
      targetType - the Class object representing the type to unbind from
      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining

    • withTypeHandler

      @NotNull public <T> @NotNull XMLMapper withTypeHandler(@NotNull @NotNull Class<T> type, @NotNull @NotNull TypeHandler<? super T> handler)
      Description copied from interface: ReadingMapper
      Registers a custom TypeHandler for the specified type.

      This method allows defining how instances of a particular type should be serialized. Handlers registered using this method take precedence over default handlers.

      Specified by:
      withTypeHandler in interface ReadingMapper<XMLMapper,Bindable>
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type for which the handler is being registered
      Parameters:
      type - the Class object representing the type to register the handler for
      handler - the TypeHandler that defines the serialization logic for the specified type
      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining

    • withTypeHandlers

      @NotNull public @NotNull XMLMapper withTypeHandlers(@NotNull @NotNull Map<Class<?>,TypeHandler<?>> handlers)
      Description copied from interface: ReadingMapper
      Registers multiple TypeHandlers at once.

      This method allows bulk registration of handlers for various types. Handlers registered using this method take precedence over default handlers.

      Specified by:
      withTypeHandlers in interface ReadingMapper<XMLMapper,Bindable>
      Parameters:
      handlers - a Map where keys are Class objects representing the types and values are their corresponding TypeHandlers
      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining

    • clearTypeHandlers

      @NotNull public @NotNull XMLMapper clearTypeHandlers()
      Description copied from interface: ReadingMapper
      Clears all registered TypeHandlers.

      This method removes all custom type handlers that have been registered, reverting to the default serialization behavior.

      Specified by:
      clearTypeHandlers in interface ReadingMapper<XMLMapper,Bindable>
      Returns:
      the current instance of M to allow method chaining
